arts.ttl: Michael Carrick addresses Middlesbrough's poor form and defensive vulnerabilities
arts.sum: Asked after the Sunderland defeat if form was a concern, the Boro boss said: “You want to win games of football, there's no getting away from that. Michael Carrick conceded his Middlesbrough side need to start winning more games but claimed form was not a concern.

arts.ttl: Every in and out deal Middlesbrough completed as the January transfer window closes
arts.sum: Josh Dede - Transfer from Celtic - undisclosed fee, initially for the under-21 squad Brayden Johnson - transfer from Eastbourne Borough - undisclosed fee, initially for the under-21 squad

arts.ttl: Brighton transfer news: Seagulls 'concede defeat' in late swoop for Sunderland's Tommy Watson
arts.sum: Brighton & Hove Albion reportedly fail in their efforts to sign Sunderland forward Tommy Watson before the transfer deadline.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough suffer Ben Doak injury blow as Carrick offers verdict on 'horrible' Sunderland loss
arts.sum: Reacting after, Carrick said: “To lose it like that is a tough one. To lose the game, to concede the goals, a deflection and an own-goal is difficult but we have to accept it.

arts.ttl: Wilson Isidor and Enzo Le Fée show class as Sunderland sink Middlesbrough
arts.athr: Louise Taylor at the Riverside Stadium
arts.sum: A terrific Tees-Wear derby illuminated by the imagination and sweet passing incision of Sunderland’s Enzo Le Fée and Middlesbrough’s Hayden Hackney ended with Régis Le Bris’s visitors only three points off an automatic promotion place. While Sunderland celebrated quite a comeback, Boro’s manager, Michael Carrick, looked almost close to tears after Le Fée glided beyond Luke Ayling and a mortified Ryan Giles diverted the Frenchman’s late cross into his own net. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ryan Giles’ own goal snatches Sunderland victory at Middlesbrough
arts.sum: The Black Cats move level on points with third-placed Burnley in the Sky Bet Championship table

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough secure Emmanuel Latte Lath replacement as former Leicester City man completes loan
arts.sum: He's made only five league starts this season and failed to score a goal, which meant Sevilla were happy to sanction his loan move to Teesside. Iheanacho, 28, was the man Boro decided to pursue as they needed a replacement for Emmanuel Latte Lath, who has joined Atlanta United in a club-record sale.

arts.ttl: Sunderland midfielder set for deadline day loan exit – Club seeking boost to promotion hopes
arts.sum: Sunderland’s Abdoullah Ba is set to join Ligue 2 side Dunkirk on loan until the end of the season, with a deal set to be finalised in the coming hours.
